Pre-Game Insights: India and Pakistan are playing in New York for the ICC Men's T20 World Cup
The 34,000-seater stadium, built in five months, is expected to be at full capacity
Pakistan's poor start in the USA means there's plenty of cricketing context to this game
Pakistan unraveled against Virat Kohli in a high-pressure finish in 2022 and were utterly overwhelmed in 2023
If Pakistan loses to India again, their chances of qualifying for the Super Eights will be at the mercy of other results going their way
India are not facing the same level of pressure as Pakistan
Pakistan's build-up to the match has been challenging, arriving late and changing hotels
India's XI is likely to remain the same as the one that beat Ireland
Imad Wasim is fit and will play for Pakistan
Azam Khan could get dropped from the Pakistan XI
Babar Azam's leadership could come under severe scrutiny if Pakistan doesn't perform well
Shivam Dube is expected to face fast bowlers like Shaheen Afridi, Naseem Shah, Mohammad Amir, and Haris Rauf
Virat Kohli has been consistent in his last four T20Is against Pakistan
Kohli has faced a total of 113 balls in T20Is from Naseem, Amir, Rauf and Shadab and never been dismissed
Miscellaneous Highlights: The stadium, built in five months, is a computer-generated rendering
Weather in New York was sunny on the eve of the match, but some weather websites have forecast showers for Sunday morning
